page.title: 04ARNCLIFFE PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: The main part of the school was built in 1876, but since then a dining room, kitchen and toilets have been added. There is a small playground at the school front, and a field at the back which, in spring, is partly covered with Snowdrops and Speedwell. The school's water supply comes from the nearby hill, and sewage goes to a septic tank in the field. The school takes primary age children from the whole dale. They start as rising-five year olds, and stay till they are aged eleven. In summer 1985 there were 17 children on roll, with one full-time teacher (the headteacher) and a part-time teacher. In their last year children take part in the a selection scheme, which determines whether they go to Secondary School in Grassington, or Grammar Schools in Skipton.
